content: diagonal garter stitch scarf gauge not important suggested needles size 4 3 50 mm straight or circular yarn 400 or more ounces of your favorite sock or fingering weight yarn for other yarn weights see note at bottom sizes will vary based on gauge and amount of yarn used stitches k = knit kfb = knit in front and back of same st k2tog = knit two together ssk = slip slip knit ___________________________________________________________________________ co 3 sts first section- increases row 1 kfb knit to end kfb row 2 knit all stitches repeat row 1 and 2 until there are 45 sts on the needle note you can adjust the width of the scarf by knitting more or fewer stitches the finished edges of your beginning triangle the two edges that do not have live stitches give a close indication of how wide your scarf will be when complete middle section- main length of the scarf row 1 kfb knit to end k2tog row 2 knit all stitches repeat these two row until you are nearly out of yarn final section- decreases row 1 ssk knit to end k2tog row 2 knit all stitches repeat these two row until there are 3 sts left on the needle bind off in your preferred method tip when you complete the first section weigh the bit of scarf you have completed this will take away some of the guess work and give you an approximation of how much yarn you need to complete the decrease section other yarn weights the same pattern can be easily used for other yarn weights work the same as for sock weight yarn just replace the 45 sts in the increase section with your desired number of stitches for worsted weight yarn 33 to 35 stitches works well for bulky weight yarns recommend anywhere from 25 to 29 there should always be an odd number of stitches if you share this pattern please give credit a link back to the website at http //www theyarnbin com is appreciated you are free to sell any scarves that you create using this pattern if you feel inclined to donate a portion of those profits to
